definition: variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels

sentences.english: This was the day he reached his peak.
sentences.chinese: 这是他达到自己生命颠峰的日子。

sentences.english: In 2046, his craft reaches its peak.
sentences.chinese: 在《2046》里，他的表演达到了颠峰。

sentences.english: Some time ago I was recalling all these years you thought you the most pain at the top.
sentences.chinese: 前些日子是我这些年来忆你最痛思你最深的颠峰。

sentences.english: When he's ready he will be brought in.
sentences.chinese: 当他准备好了，他将重新回到颠峰。

sentences.english: Although he is past his prime, he is at the peak of his career.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他已过了他的全盛期，他正在事业的颠峰。

sentences.english: In AD 80, the Roman Empire was on top of the world.
sentences.chinese: 公元80年，罗马帝国的国力正处于世界颠峰。

sentences.english: This change happens when Wu Zetian's power rises to a historical height.
sentences.chinese: 这个变化是在武则天走向权力颠峰的背景下出现的。

sentences.english: Speaking like this, it seems to me that existence breathes the free air of the summit.
sentences.chinese: 谈到像这一点，我觉得生命实存呼吸颠峰的自由空气。

sentences.english: The summit can, though, be opposed to decline as evil to good.
sentences.chinese: 虽然如此，颠峰能够跟衰微对立，如同恶与善对立。

sentences.english: We can dance, we can jive, having the time of our life.
sentences.chinese: 舞动吧，欢跃吧，尽情享受我们人生的颠峰时刻。

sentences.english: She clawed her way to the top of her career.
sentences.chinese: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她事业的颠峰。

sentences.english: The 11th-13th centuries mark the high point of medieval civilization.
sentences.chinese: 13世纪成为中世纪文化发展的颠峰时期。

definition: summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
the Saint of War (i.e. the deified Guan Yu 關羽|关羽[Guan1 Yu3])
great scholar respected for learning and integrity
